unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – India’s ambitious smart meter deployment program is gaining traction, with several states exceeding initial rollout targets. Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL) reports installation figures have significantly improved since the program’s inception in 2021.
normalised: New Delhi – India's ambitious smart meter deployment program is gaining traction, with several states exceeding initial rollout targets. Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL) reports installation figures have significantly improved since the program's inception in two thousand and twenty one.

unnormalised: Maharashtra, particularly around Mumbai and Pune, shows promising adoption rates, contributing significantly to reduced Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses. Rajasthan is also witnessing increased deployments with Jaipur discom actively promoting smart meter benefits to consumers through awareness campaigns scheduled for 10:00 hrs every Tuesday starting 16/07/2024.
normalised: Maharashtra, particularly around Mumbai and Pune, shows promising adoption rates, contributing significantly to reduced Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses. Rajasthan is also witnessing increased deployments with Jaipur discom actively promoting smart meter benefits to consumers through awareness campaigns scheduled for ten hundred hours every Tuesday starting sixteenth July two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Tamil Nadu Electricity Board (TNEB) is leveraging the Union government's Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) to accelerate smart meter installation across its service areas. The RDSS aims to modernize the distribution infrastructure, culminating in a pan-India rollout by 31/03/2025. Early data suggests households with smart meters average a 15% reduction in electricity consumption after the initial 3 months of installation.
normalised: Tamil Nadu Electricity Board (T N E B) is leveraging the Union government's Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S) to accelerate smart meter installation across its service areas. The R D S S aims to modernize the distribution infrastructure, culminating in a pan-India rollout by thirty first March two thousand and twenty five. Early data suggests households with smart meters average a fifteen percent reduction in electricity consumption after the initial three months of installation.

unnormalised: Further deployments are planned in Uttar Pradesh, particularly in the Lucknow region, starting 01/08/2024, aiming to cover 5 lakh households within the next fiscal year.
normalised: Further deployments are planned in Uttar Pradesh, particularly in the Lucknow region, starting first August two thousand and twenty four, aiming to cover five lakh households within the next fiscal year.
